DOC.brief_title: Short Term Effect Post Surgical Treatment Mirror Therapy Phantom Limb Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Aim : - Measurement short term effect post surgical/ post-operative mirror therapy concern pain intensity patient upper low amputation comparison standard occupational/ physical therapy - Hypothesis : patient intervention group ( mirror therapy ) suffer significant less phantom limb pain low pain frequency within follow-up period 4-8 week Methods : - Design : multicenter , prospective , randomize control trial - Participants : 70 , 35 per intervention con-trol group - Intervention group : treatment session 60 minute mirror therapy period 14 day start directly post surgical ( 24-48 hour ) - Control group : receive treatment session 60 minute treatment frequency period 14 day - Measurement tool : Primary objectives - pain intensity ( 11 point NRS , phantom limb in-tensity ) - pain frequency ( amount pain attack ) Secondary objective - diary - daily assessment mirror physical thera-py session - analysis : - significant difference group covariance analysis perform - comparison median
